div.sent: He said to them, Come with me, and I will teach you to catch men.
At once they left their nets and went with him.
He went on and saw two other brothers, James and John, the sons of Zebedee.
They were in their boat with their father Zebedee, getting their nets ready.
Jesus called them, and at once they left the boat with the net and their father, and went with him.
Then Jesus called Philip and his friend Bartholomew to be his disciples.
On another day, Jesus called Mathew the tax collector saying, Come with me.
Mathew became his disciple and followed him.
In this way Jesus gathered his disciples and began the process of entrusting to them his divine and human mission.
When parents and guardians grow old, they entrust the responsibilities of their families to their own children.
They hand over their responsibility to them before they die, so that the work begun by them may continue well.
In the same way, Jesus called his disciples and handed over to them the mission of saving mankind.
Jesus Appoints Twelve Apostles In order to carry on his mission, Jesus chose and appointed twelve disciples who are called Apostles.
The word `apostle means one who is sent.
Now listen to story of how Jesus chose them and laid the foundation of his Church.:
One day Jesus went up a hill to pray and spent the whole night there praying to God.
When day came, he came down and called his disciples to him and chose twelve of them, whom he named apostles.
Accompanied by these twelve disciples, Jesus went around preaching.
He told them, you must go to the whole world and preach the message of salvation to all men.
Those who will believe and receive baptism will live according to my teaching.
Jesus gave his disciples authority to drive out demons, to heal the sick and work miracles.
He even gave them power to raise the dead to life.
The other disciples of Jesus and many others who believed in him came from different places and gathered around him.
They came to hear Jesus and to be healed of their diseases.
Those who were troubled by evil spirits were also brought to him to be healed.
A large crowd of people was there from all over Judea and from Jerusalem and from the coastal cities of Tyre and Sidon.
All the people tried to touch him, for power was going out from him and healing them all.
Jesus Sends Out the Disciples to Preach Jesus called the Disciples together and began to send them out to preach.
He sent them out two by two, to go ahead of him to every town and place where he himself was about to go.
As Jesus began to send out his disciples, he warned them saying, Go!
I am sending you like lambs among ferocious animals and wolves.
You must be as cautious as snakes and as gentle as doves.
Go and preach : The Kingdom of God is near!
You have received without paying, so give without being paid.
Do not carry a beggar's bag for the journey or any money or shoes.
Don't waste any time on the road.
Whenever you go into a house, first say, Peace be with you.
Whenever you go into a town and are made welcome, eat what is set before you, heal the sick, comfort those who are sorrowful.
In my name do good to those who are in need by the power given to you.
If they do not welcome you, then move to somewhere else.
Then they will be deprived of the gift of peace.
That village or town will not be able to see the signs of your good works.
The disciples went out to preach the Word of God as Jesus had directed them.
They called people to conversion and advised them to come back to the right path.
They experienced great joy and happiness as they went around preaching.
After a few days they came back rejoicing and praising God to share with Jesus what had happened as a result of their preaching.
They reported to Jesus what they had done and preached.
They said, Lord, even the demons obeyed us when we gave them a command in your name!
Jesus answered them, Listen!
But don't be glad because the evil spirits obey you; rather be glad because your names are written in heaven.
An eternal reward is awaiting you in heaven.
Again he looked at his disciples and said, How fortunate you are to see the things you see!
Now you truly realize how great was the authority that the disciples of Jesus enjoyed.
For they were obedient, simple, humble, faithful, dependent on God and responsible.
They prepared themselves as Jesus had wanted them to, and they were always conscious of their duties and were eager to fulfil them.
Each one of is a disciple chosen by Christ himself.
To us also he says, Go, preach the Good News to all people.
Do good to those who are in need.
Are we attentive to this call?
He has given us power to do great works.
Are we eager to use that power ?
If we wish serve God and men.
we have to accept Jesus as our Lord and Mas ter, and we have to believe in God's salvation and grace.
We have to live in accordance with the teachings of Jesus,his example and we have to be inspired by his spirit.
We have to have faith, humility, simplicity, spirit of obedience, truthfulness, fidelity, fear of God, piety; devotion and love for people.
We have to constantly practise these virtues.
In a spirit of humility, obedience, determination, hard-work, foresight and enthusiasm we have to prepare ourselves through studies.
We have to avoid being arrogant, disobedient and lazy.
Are we ready to do so?
Do I have enough interest in religion, in work and in studies ?
Or, do I just go around playing and wasting my time in gossiping and idleness ?
Why has God created you ?
Did he create you so that you could become learned, amass wealth and money, and live in luxury ?
Or is it to live and work for God and men ?
What are the spiritual and moral qualities you have in you?
What are the bad qualities in you ?
Are you ready to give these up and begin a new life from today ?
Upto now how have you suffered on accound of being disobedient to your parents and teachers ?
What do you intend to do now ?
What would you resolve to do ?
How interested are you in religious practices and higher education ?
Do have any desire to do something good for the society and the country ?
Or, are you just thinking of going abroad and earn big money after you get your education ?
Are you polite and courteous in your dealings with others, or are you arrogant, rude and impolite ?
Who are your friends ?
Are they well- behaved and well-mannered ?
Do they give you good advice, or do they lead you astray ?
I will welcome what builds me up and reject what is bad for me.
I will reflect on God's will for me and share it freely with my parents, teachers and the parish priest.
I will be attentive in my studies and take good care of my body and soul.
Without virtue, no one can be successful or reach the goal in life.
Such a person is not entrusted with any responsibility and he does not receive any honour.
Happiness disappears from his life and he finds only misery as his companion.
Earthly success depends on special qualities, such as knowledge, experience, foresight, industriousness, courage, patience, humility, etc.
If a farmer wishes to reap a good harvest, he has to work hard.
Moreover he has to have some experience and skill.
He was to know when the right season for planting is.
A good farmer will procure good seed and sow it at the right time and apply fertilizer in due time.
He has to keep watch so that the insects do not attack the crop, and if necessary use insecticide.
Isn't it so ?
A soldier has to parade regularly.
He has to be healthy, abide by rules of the army and learn the art of war.
One who rules a country has to know how to administer and take care of the citizens.
A teacher has to have knowledge, learn the method of teaching, have patience, affection, sense of time and discipline.
Only an expert and courageous boatman can steer the boat to its destination when there is a storm.
The story of the famous sailors, Columbus and Vasco da Gama, inspires us.
In the same way, a good disciple of Jesus or a good Christian must possess some spiritual, moral and human qualities.
The disciples of Christ have to fulfil the responsibilities given to them by Christ.
This is certainly not an easy task.
That is why Jesus said, For my sake you will be brought to trial.
I am sending you out just like sheep to a pack of wolves.
What is faith?
To have faith is to be sure of the things we hope for, to be certain of the things we cannot see.
Faith, hope and charity-these are theological virtues.
It is faith that strengthens our hope for the eternal life, and confirms and enriches our love for God and men.
To believe in One God and to worship him alone.
There are three persons in One God : Father, Son and Holy Spirit.
God the Son became Incarnated for us, he died on the Cross and rose on the third day.
Every Christian has to believe in One God and his son Jesus Christ who died, rose and ascended into heaven.
We have to firmly believe that Christ is the Son of God, he is the Saviour of mankind, and we have to depend on him.
A disciple has to love him, believe in him and hope for the eternal life through him.
For there is no other way to enter into eternal life except Christ.
Jesus himself said, I am the way, the truth, and the life.
No one can enter into eternal life except by me.
In the Bible it is written : One day Jesus asked his disciples, Who do people say the son of Man is ?
They answered, Some say John the Baptist, others as Elijah, while others say Jeremiah or some other prophet.
Then Jesus asked, What about you?
Who do you say I am ?
Simon Peter answered, Your are the Messiah, the son of the living God.
Jesus said, Good for you, Simon.
For this truth did not come to you form any human being, but it was given to you directly by my Father in heaven.
And so I tell you.
How happy are those who have no doubts about me.
Lord Jesus, strengthen my faith in God the Father.
Help me to remain firm and withstand the allurements of the world and the enticements of others.
Lord Jesus, be with me and guide me.
There is no salvation without faith and good works.
`Fidelity is another special quality of a true disciple of Christ.
It is the duty of a Christian to believe in Christ and to do his work faithfully and obey his commandments.
Children who obey their parents and the respected elders never go astray.
They can overcome all dangers in life.
A faithful son is the pride of his father.
He brings honour and glory to him.
A faithful servant is entrusted with many responsibilities.
The sense of responsibility of a faithful servant brings much comfort and joy to his master.
In the same way, God wants that his disciples always remain faithful and do their duties well.
In this way, both the master and the servant are happy.
An unfaithful servant is driven away and punished by his master.
Similarly, on the Day of the Last Judgement Jesus will say to those who are unfaithful, Away from me, you that are under God's curse!
I do not know you.
Away to the eternal fire which has been prepared for you.
But to those who were faithful he will say, Come, you that are blessed by my Father !
Come and possess the kingdom which has been prepared for you ever since the creation of the world.
You must have heard about the parable of `the faithful and the unfaithful servant in the Bible.
A man who was about to go on a journey called his servants and put them in charge of his property.
He gave a certain amount of money to each one according to his ability.
He wanted them to invest the money in business and earn a profit.
Those who made the investment and earned profit, the master called them good and faithful servants.
He said, Well done, you good and faithful servant!
You have been faithful in managing small amounts, so I will put you in charge of large amounts.
Come on in and shore my happiness!.
The servant who had received one talent, did not invest it.
Take this useless servant and throw him outside in the darkness; there he will cry and grind his teeth.
Moreover, he has to have love for God, faith and hope in him and piety and practice of religion.
What are the good qualities you have received from God ?
Are you faithfully making good use of those qualities ?
Do you pay attention to your studies, practice religion and attend the religious services ?
Do you do well the duties assigned to you by your teachers and pastors ?
Are you faithful in doing the duties assigned to you by your parents at home?
Do you try to develop your God-given knowledge, intelligence, skill, etc.
Or do you, like that useless servant, spend time in idleness ?
Lord, help me to overcome my infidelity and laziness.
Help me to be honest and faithful in developing the talents you have given me.
Help me to seek perfection in my spiritual and moral life by faithfully doing my duties.
This I pray in the name of Jesus.
God is full of love; he is infinitely merciful; he loves sinners.
He forgives the sins of all.
He calls the lost sheep to give up sins and come back to the way of justice, and he gives his inspiration and help.
Out of love for man he became Man and died on the Cross.
He gives hope to those who are on the verge of despair.
He heals the sick.
He shows the way to those who are confused.
He said, Come to me, all of you who are tired from carrying heavy loads, and I will give you rest.
It is in God's nature to love.
He is the source and model of pure love.
God wants that we love him and other people.
No one should be excluded form our love, whatever their race, religion or caste may be.
Only then there will be peace, happiness, joy and prosperity on this earth.
Without love there can be no happiness.
It is impossible to reach the Ultimate goal of life i.
e., God and his Kingdom, without love.
One day a Scribe, wanting to test Jesus, asked him, Teacher, what must I do to receive eternal life?
What is your greatest commandment to us?
That is why he asked again, Who is my neighbour?
In answer Jesus told the parable of the Good Samaritan: The robbers attacked him, stripped him, and beat him up, leaving him half dead.
A Jewish priest saw him in this condition, by he walked on by, on the other side.
In the same way a Levite also walked away on the other side.
They felt no compassion towards the wounded man.
He went over to him and carefully bandaged his wounds.
Then he put the man on his own horse and took him to an inn.
He paid some money to the innkeeper and told him that he would come again on this way back.
If the expenses are more than what he already paid, he would pay the rest.
But he asked him to take good care of the man.
After telling the story Jesus asked the teacher of the Law.
In your opinion, which one of these three acted like a neighbour towards the man attacked by the robbers?
He replied, The one who was kind to him.
Then Jesus said, ``You go, then, and do the same.
All men and women have been created by God and so they are all our neighbours, our brothers and sisters.
Hence we should extend our services to people who are in danger, who are needy, helpless and are oppressed without distinguishing their race or religion.
This is the ideal Christ has taught us.
His love is universal It is not confined within any boundaries of religion place, time or race.
There is something more: True love is not a matter of mere words or talk.
Love has to be expressed concretely in words, work, behaviour and attitude in everyday life.
It is an ideal rule of life.
True love has some characteristics.
I may have the gift of inspired preaching;
I may have all knowledge and understand all secrets;
I may have all the faith needed to move mountains- but if I have no love, I am nothing.
Love is patient and kind;
it is not jealous or conceited or proud;
love is not ill-mannered or selfish or irritable;
love does no keep a record of wrongs;
love is not happy with evil, but is happy with the truth.
Love never gives up; and its faith, hope and patience never fail.
Love is eternal everything else will pass away.
Faith, hope and love-these three remain; and the greatest of these is love.
All the works and examples of Jesus teach this to us.
He has told us, Love one another, as I have loved you.
Gratitude also is a spiritual and moral quality.
An ungrateful person loses the tenderness and humility of his heart.
An ungrateful person often treads the path of injustice and commits sins of anger, envy, pride and revenge.
To commit sins and to walk in sin and injustice mean ingratitude towards God and it is hateful.
God is the Creator of heaven and earth.
He became Man out of love for men; he died on the Cross to save mankind.
He created this earth and everything in it: the sun and the moon; the stars and the planets.
He has, given us life, he has given us, our parents and our relatives.
He sustains and nourishes us with animals, birds, plants and tress, light, air and water.
He keeps everything alive.
For this reason man should praise, adore and thank God.
The heart of an ungrateful person is filled with the sins of pride, arrogance and slander.
He depends on his own power and wealth which finally lead him to his downfall.
We have to express our gratitude to them as well.
How can those who don't show gratitude to men, show gratitude to God ?
By showing our gratitude to men in practical life, we develop a habit of showing gratitude to God.
This causes our human nature, our character and our thinking shine with beauty.
In the Bible it is written : One day as Jesus made his way to Jerusalem, he went along the border between Samaria and Galilee.
He was going into a village when he was met by ten men suffering from a dreaded skin-disease.
They stood at a distance and shouted, Jesus!
Take pity on us.
Jesus was moved with pity and he said to them, Go and let the priests examine you.
On the way they were made clean.
No trace of skin-disease remained on their bodies.
But only one of them came back praising God in a loud voice.
He threw himself to the ground at Jesus feet and thanked him.
The man was a Samaritan.
The Samaritans were treated by the Jews and the Levites and untouchable and low caste.
Jesus was disappointed and said, There were ten men who were healed; where are the other nine ?
Why is this foreigner the only one who came back to give thanks to God ?
How many times during the day do we thank God the Giver of life for his manifold graces and blessings ?
Have I said even once today: Lord I thank you for your mercy and blessings ?
Do we express our gratitude to our parents, relatives, elders and friends for their help and cooperation, kindness and hard work ?
If we have not build up this habit already, let us begin changing our attitude today:
From now on we will show our gratitude to God and to our fellowmen for their help.
With tenderness and humility we will thank them.
God is our forgiving Father.
He forgives us all our sins.
No matter how serious our sins are, if we are truly repentant and humbly ask for forgiveness, God forgives us.
God does not want that even the least of his children be lost.
Jesus has the authority to forgive our sins, no matter how serious they are.
For he is God.
God also wants that we ask for forgiveness from one another and we are reconciled to one another.
And in this way we build up our relationship with the Father and the son.
Jesus is both God and Man.
By his teaching and example he has shown us how we should love and forgive one another.
He said, Love and forgive one another just as I have loved and forgiven you.
Jesus healed man's bodily illness, drove out demons and restored peace of mind.
But he did a far greater work than these, viz., he forgave man's sins.
He has taught us how obtain forgiveness.
It is by means of forgiveness that we find eternal salvation.
It is for this reason that Jesus is our Saviour and our God who forgives.
In the sight of God all of us are sinners.
Every human person is in need of asking and granting forgiveness.
When we are forgiven, we are reconciled with Jesus.
If we say we have no sins in us, we deceive ourselves, and there is no truth in us.
But if we are repentant and we confess our sins to God, he will forgive us our sins and purify us from all our wrongdoing.
He is trustworthy, he will always keep his promises.
If anyone does sin, we have someone who pleads with the Father on our behalfJesus Christ, the righteous one.
Christ himself is the means by which our sins are forgiven, and not our sins only, but also the sins of everyone.
On the Cross Jesus prayed, Forgive them, Father!
They don't know what they are doing.
Jesus prayed to the Father for those who had unjustly crucified him and he forgave them.
One of the criminals who were crucified with him repented and said, Remember me, Jesus, when you come as King!
And Jesus said to him, I promise you that today you will be in Paradise with me.
When Jesus said to the paralysed man, Courage, my son!
Your sins are forgiven., the teachers of the Law said to themselves, This man is speaking blasphemy.
But Jesus, perceiving what they were thinking, said, I will prove to you that the son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins.
So he said to the paralysed man, Get up, pick up your bed, and go home.
The man got up at once and went home.
Remember that woman who was a public sinner.
She sat at Jesus feet repentant.
She was weeping and wetting feet with her tears.
Then she dried his feet with her hair.
She poured the perfume made of pure nard she had brought in a beautiful white crystal bottle on Jesus, two feet and kissed them.
She firmly resolved up the sinful life she had been living in that city and begin a new life.
Jesus knew she was repentant, and so he said to her, Your sins are forgiven.
Your faith has saved you; go in peace.
When the Pharisee who had invited Jesus and all the others present there saw this, questioned in their mind what kind of behavior that was.
The woman, a public sinner, was touching him and he said nothing ?
Moreover, he said, Go, your sins are forgiven ?
Who is this man who even forgives sins ?
Now you understand what authority Jesus had.
Therefore, if we commit sins, we should not be afraid and despair.
We only have to hate our sins, repent and give up sinning, and humbly surrender to Jesus.
Jesus has given was a new commandment: Love one another and forgive one another.
Forgiveness is necessary for reconciliation.
God does not forgive someone who does not forgive others.
In the Lord's Prayer, Jesus has taught us to say : Forgive us our sins as we forgive those who sin against us.
This shows that we have to be ready to forgive others if we want to be forgiven by God ours sins and offences.
Jesus said, If you forgive others the wrongs they have done to you, your Father in heaven will also forgive you.
But if you do not forgive others, then your Father will not forgive the wrongs you have done.
Concerning forgiveness, Jesus forbade us to say: I can never do it.
Seven times ?
Jesus answered, No, not seven times, but seventy times seven.
Otherwise your punishment will be terrible.
With the help of many such parables Jesus taught us about forgiveness.
For instance, his advice : If anyone slaps you on the right cheek, let him slap your left cheek too.
The story of the Prodigal son also teaches us about forgiveness.
Do you remember ?
In the previous lesson you learned about forgiveness.
It was briefly mentioned there that in order to be forgiven, one has to be truly repentant.
In the same way, we have to be sincerely sorry for our sins and then ask Jesus for forgiveness.
It is not enough just to say with my mouth that I want to be forgiven.
I need to be truly repentant.
When we examine our conscience, we think deeply and recall all our sins.
I do not hide anything and I am not hesitant or afraid.
This examination of conscience helps us to realize the seriousness of every sin and feel its pain.
Then we become sorry for our sins and feel compunction.
Just as gold is not purified without being tested by fire, so our hearts cannot be cleansed without repentance.
In repenting we realize that we have offended God who is infinitely great.
Our offences not only cause pain to God, but also makes us realize that we have become guilty of crucifying him.
Our heart, soul and conscience have become contaminated.
God is no longer present in our soul, instead Satan occupies his place.
We become alienated from God and his commandments.
I am bound to go to hell.
Such deep thoughts produces compunction and makes me bow my head towards God.
In true repentance the fear of hell does not come first, but rather sorrow for having offended God.
Then comes resolution: I will not commit sin any more.
At the same time I must confess my sins and ask God for forgiveness.
Through penance and confession, through professing faith in God and surrendering ourselves to him, our filial and loving relationship with God is restored.
Our soul once again becomes the abode of God; he comes to live in our hearts, Our soul becomes pure and holy.
The realization that by her small and serious sins she had offended God brought Mary Magdalene to Jesus.
Sorrow for her sins caused her to shed tears with which she washed the feet of Jesus and wiped them with her hair.
Out of love for Jesus, she poured the perfume on his feet, and then bent down and kissed them.
In the same way, the Prodigal son returned to his father when he realized his mistake.
He said, Father, I have sinned against God and against you.
I am no longer fit to be called your son; treat me as one of your hired workers.
From these two examples we can learn about repentance for sins.
Do 1 repent sincerely when I commit sins?
Do I feel pain in my heart for having offended God? Do I promise to God to give up sins and.
return to the right path? Have I asked for forgiveness when I offended my parents, teachers and other respected elders and became disobedient?
Have I asked for forgiveness when I offended my companions?
Is my relationship with them cordial, or is it only superficial?
Merciful God, I have offended you by my sins; please forgive me.
Help me not to sin any more.
Help me to avoid sins and live according to your teaching and commandments.
This I pray in the name of Jesus Christ, Our Lord.
I will learn the Act of Contrition and other penitential prayers by heart.
If I commit any sins, in small or serious matters, I will ask for God's forgiveness.
I will show respect to all people and I will be tolerant.
I will shun the path of sin and evil.
I will be kind to my friends, younger brothers and sisters, and classmates.
I will try to understand that God is just and he is my supremely best friend.
I will deepen our relationship with God.
Obedience to God is a Christian virtue.
The exercise and development of this virtue is essential for growth in spiritual life.
God is our Creator, our Father, our Friend.
He is Almighty.
His love for us is infinite and he has shown us the way to salvation.
Therefore, obedience to him is essential for attaining perfection in life.
Adam and Eve were not obedient to God, hence they fell into sin.
There are many such examples in the Bible.
Those who are not obedient to God are bound to fall into sin and stumble in darkness.
We find supreme obedience in the life of Jesus.
He fulfilled the will of God fully in his life.
Father, not as I want, but your will be done.
While breathing his last on the Cross he said, Father, into your hands I commend my spirit.
What a unique expression of obedience!
It is because he was so completely obedient to God the Father that he taught us a wonderful prayer.
We call it the Lord's Prayer.
In this earthly life Jesus told us to train ourselves well in obedience to our parents and respected elders.
If we do so, we not only become happy and make progress, but we also grow spiritually.
The fourth of the Ten Commandments says: Honour your father and mother.
It is the duty of a soldier to obey the General.
It is the duty of the citizens to obey the rulers.
To be obedient in practice means to submit.
We obey by observing the commandments, directions, teachings and rules:
Those who do not observe them, make their own life and that of others unhappy.
create chaos and confusion.
Recall how the evil-minded Pharisees tried to trap Jesus by asking him a question :
Teacher, we know that you are true, and teach the way of God truthfully, and care for man.
Tell us, then, what you think.
Is it lawful to pay taxes to Caesar, or not?
But Jesus, aware of their malice, said, Why to put me to the test, you hypocrites?
Render to Caesar the things that are Caesar's, and to God the things that are God's.
When they heard it, they marvelled; and they left him and went away.
There is another way of being obedient.
And that is honesty and fidelity.
One who is not obedient is dishonest and unfaithful.
He becomes unruly and arrogant.
And the consequences of this is terrible, his life gets ruined.
So you see what Christian obedience means what its essential characteristics are.
We have to practise these virtues if we wish to be a true disciple of Christ and want to go to heaven.
Jesus said, I am the way, the truth, and the life; no one receive eternal life.
He also said, I am the vine, and you are the branches.
You cannot bear fruit unless you remain in me.
To remain in him means to serve the Lord God alone and to live according to his teaching and camanandments.
Am I obedient to God ?
Do I observe the Ten Commandments with faith and love?
Am I obedient to my parents, teachers and respected elders ?
Do I follow their orders and directions?
Do I maintain discipline in school and in the society?
Do I have bad habits and attitudes of disobedience, arrogance, gossiping, ruthlessness, addictions, unruly behaviour?
Am I resolved to overcome these?
I will wholeheartedly obey God, love him and do his will.
I will give up all my bad habits, arrogance and misbehaviour:
I will live a simple and cheerful life like a child.
Lord, be with me.
Help me to keep my resolutions.
Help me to overcome all my vices and bad habits.
Increase my spirit of obedience, faith, hope and love.
Lord, I entrust myself to you and I ask you to be always merciful and gracious to me.
Help me to remain in you.
Humility is essential for growth and success in Christian life.
Without humility it is impossible to live according to the teachings of Jesus.
A humble person lives in accordance with the will of God and observes his commandments.
He is patient and persevering.
He is considerate and just, he avoids evil paths.
He is simple like a child and innocent like a lamb.
Through his example and teachings Jesus has taught us the way of humility, forgiveness and love.
The opposite of humility is pride, arrogance and anger.
These are the causes of conflicts, spirit of revenge, greed and indiscipline.
A person who is humble receives honour, enjoys peace and gradually attains great success.
He avoids envy, indecent actions and greed.
A humble person does not boast.
Humility or meekness is a fruit of the Spirit.
It is a source of joy and it helps develop many other spiritual and moral virtues.
Jesus said, Happy are those who are humble; they will receive what God has promised.
Humility does not mean lack of wealth.
Humility means gentleness, meekness and dependence on God.
The supreme example of humility is Jesus, who was obedient to God even to the death on the Cross.
And now he is seated at the right hand of God.
I, your Lord and Teachers, have just washed your feet.
You, then, should wash one another's feet.
I have set an example for you, so that you will do just what I have done for you.
I am telling you the truth : no slave is greater than his master, and no messenger is greater than the one who sent him.
Now that you know this truth, how happy you will be if you put it into practice!.
What a wonderful lesson of humility Jesus has taught us.
In another place he says, The son of Man did not come to be served, but to serve.
If one of you wants to be great, he must be the servant of the rest.
Jesus told another beautiful story which teaches about humility.
Once there were two men who went up to the Temple to pray : one was a Pharisee, the other a tax collector.
The Pharisee stood apart by himself and prayed, Cop thank you, God, that I am not greedy, dishonest, or an adulterer, like everybody else.
I thank you that I am not like that tax collector over there.

Suffering and Mortification Success and maturity in the Christian life cannot be attained without suffering and mortification.
Suffering, persecution and insults are unavoidable in the life of a Christian.
Through suffering and mortification we become true and mature disciples of Christ.
From the lives of saints and great man it appears that not through seeking pleasures, but through renunciation, we attain the proximity of God.
Priests, Brothers, Sisters and other religious and saintly persons accept these renunciation and practices as vows.
They renounce worldly pleasures and luxuries in order to seek perfection and to devote themselves to the service of all.
Many even had to die.
Therefore, they went to God in heaven and now enjoy eternal bliss.
The teachings and the examples of saints and great men help us to make our journey to God.
For truth and ideals never become outdated.
Their suffering and practice of mortification serve us as ideals for all times and for all people.
They are ever new and a source of inspiration.
Hence, persecution, renunciation and mortifications are essential for the spiritual growth of the servants of the Church.
No one can go to God without following this path.
Suffering and mortification are a must for a servant of Christ.
By being persecuted, and by dying on the Cross, Jesus has taught us this lesson.
In the present condition of the world where there is so much injustice, oppression, exploitation and conflicts, there is a greater need for this.
This need will be there, till the end of the world.
For the main task of the Church is to preach the Word, where persecution is bound to come and sufferings and mortifications cannot be avoided.

Jesus Sermon on the Mount or the Beatitudes is the New Law given by God for the Salvation of mankind.
Through this Sermon Jesus has shown us a new way of entering into the Kingdom of God.
In this Sermon Jesus gives a new direction for man's eternal salvation.
Jesus has left behind this Word for his disciples and for the whole human race.
He wants that all live according to this Word and in this way attain salvation.
All through the ages the Church has been preaching these Beatitudes to people who are hoping for salvation.
The practice of the Beatitudes help us to grow spiritually and to make progress on our way to attaining eternal life.
